    • Method Detail

      • loadEnv

        public static java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> loadEnv()

      • getEnvironmentMap

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getEnvironmentMap()
        A wrapper layer around System.getenv().

        On Windows, the returned map is case-insensitive (i.e. map.get("Path") == map.get("PATH") holds).

        On Mac OS X things are complicated.
        An app launched by a GUI launcher (Finder, Dock, Spotlight etc.) receives a pretty empty and useless environment, since standard Unix ways of setting variables via e.g. ~/.profile do not work. What's more important, there are no sane alternatives. This causes a lot of user complaints about tools working in a terminal not working when launched from the IDE. To ease their pain, the IDE loads a shell environment (see getShellEnv() for gory details) and returns it as the result.
        And one more thing (c): locale variables on OS X are usually set by a terminal app - meaning they are missing even from a shell environment above. This again causes user complaints about tools being unable to output anything outside ASCII range when launched from the IDE. Resolved by adding LC_CTYPE variable to the map if it doesn't contain explicitly set locale variables (LANG/LC_ALL/LC_CTYPE). See setCharsetVar(Map) for details.

        Returns:
        unmodifiable map of the process environment.

      • getValue

        public static java.lang.String getValue(java.lang.String name)
        Same as getEnvironmentMap().get(name). Returns value for the passed environment variable name, or null if no such variable found.
        See Also:
        getEnvironmentMap()

      • getEnvironment

        public static java.lang.String [] getEnvironment()
        Same as flattenEnvironment(getEnvironmentMap()). Returns an environment as an array of "NAME=VALUE" strings.
        See Also:
        getEnvironmentMap()

      • flattenEnvironment

        public static java.lang.String [] flattenEnvironment(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> environment)

      • isValidName

        public static boolean isValidName(java.lang.String name)
        Validates environment variable name in accordance to ProcessEnvironment#validateVariable (ProcessEnvironment#validateName on Windows).
        See Also:
        isValidValue(String), Environment Variables in Unix, Environment Variables in Windows

      • isValidValue

        public static boolean isValidValue(java.lang.String value)
        Validates environment variable value in accordance to ProcessEnvironment#validateValue.
        See Also:
        isValidName(String)

      • buildShellProcessCommand

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> buildShellProcessCommand(java.lang.String shellScript,
                                                                        boolean isLogin,
                                                                        boolean isInteractive,
                                                                        boolean isCommand)
        Builds a login shell command list from the shellScript path.
        Parameters:
        shellScript - path to the shell script, probably taken from environment variable SHELL
        isLogin - true iff it should be login shell, usually -l parameter
        isInteractive - true iff it should be interactive shell, usually -i parameter
        isCommand - true iff command should accept a command, instead of script name, usually -c parameter
        Returns:
        list of commands for starting a process, e.g. /bin/bash -l -i -c

      • parseEnv

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parseEnv(java.lang.String... lines)
